title: Geneve postmarks - What are those 3 fonts?
content:
Hello,  
What are those 3 fonts?  
Thanks and regards.  
See the attached pictures.

1200 GENÈVE  
(digits)  
RUE DU STAND

PS. I post this question here because the online tool [http://new.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016052616/http:/new.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/ "http://new.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/") failed.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [ron.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016052616/http:/typophile.com/files/ron_0.JPG) | 199.04 KB |
author: samz

comments.content:
Hi Sam,

welcome to Typophile!  
Please note that you get faster feedback when you post such ID requests on the [Type ID Board](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016052616/http:/typophile.com/typeid).

Postmarks use custom letters, i.e. there is probably no digital font that perfectly matches your sample.

For an approximation of the date (digits): this might be a case for [Linotype DIN Next](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016052616/http:/www.linotype.com/en/5798/dinnext.html). It has the ‘9’ with the rounded bottom, as an alternative glyph. Neither DIN Engschrift, FF DIN nor PF DIN seem to have this form.  
DIN Next has a Condensed, and a Rounded. Alas, no Condensed Rounded.

Alternatively, there’s [Gravur Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016052616/http:/www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Gravur+Condensed/).

Cheers,  
F

If the stamped look is of importance, try [Linotype Tagesstempel](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016052616/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/linotype_tagesstempel_complete_vp/?&sample_text=0123456789&sample_size=74).
